etymologies: mid 19th century: from modern Latin spora, from Greek spora ‘sowing, seed’, from speirein ‘to sow’

definitions: a minute, typically one-celled, reproductive unit capable of giving rise to a new individual without sexual fusion, characteristic of lower plants, fungi, and protozoans.
shortDefinitions: minute reproductive unit capable of giving rise to new individual without sexual fusion, characteristic of lower plants and protozoans

definitions: (in a plant exhibiting alternation of generations) a haploid reproductive cell which gives rise to a gametophyte.
shortDefinitions: (in plant exhibiting alternation of generations) haploid reproductive cell which gives rise to gametophyte

definitions: (in bacteria) a rounded resistant form adopted by a bacterial cell in adverse conditions.
shortDefinitions: (in bacteria) rounded resistant form adopted by bacterial cell in adverse conditions
